definition: to collapse/to be worn out/to break down
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
rope/to bind together/to twist around
surname Lei
to collapse/to break or wear down/to defeat

sentences.english: Long hours, inadequate food, and overwork had weakened him.
sentences.chinese: 工作时间长，食物不足，劳累过度累垮了他的身体。

sentences.english: These active toddlers have really worn me down.
sentences.chinese: 这些活动力很强的小朋友真的让我累垮了。

sentences.english: The horses were done over completely.
You should take a rest or you'll be exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 你应该休息一下，否则你会累垮的。

sentences.english: During the trip, Darlene and I took turns driving so that neither of us would tire out.
sentences.chinese: 旅途中，达伦和我轮流开车，这样才不会有人累垮。

sentences.english: Well, with all that work he does, he could end up as a physical wreck someday.
sentences.chinese: 他做那么多工作，以后可能会最终把身体累垮的。

sentences.english: The long journey really knocked me up.
sentences.chinese: 长途旅行真把我累垮了。

sentences.english: "I have crashed and burned and hit the wall in my first marathon, " she replies.
sentences.chinese: “我第一次跑马拉松时，撞墙了，累垮了，”她回答。

sentences.english: yesterday I collapsed while carrying a computer uspstairs.
sentences.chinese: 昨天，在把一台计算机搬上楼时，我累垮了。

sentences.english: It's back-breaking labor with severe health consequences.
sentences.chinese: 它累垮了劳力，造成了严重的健康问题。

sentences.english: He  has been overspent with the work.
sentences.chinese: 那项工作已把他累垮了。

sentences.english: Don't knock yourself out with hardwork.
sentences.chinese: 不要太辛苦而把自己累垮。

sentences.english: She feared that he would burn himself out or break down.
sentences.chinese: 她担心他会累垮或变得衰弱。

sentences.english: Then his health broke down, and he had to take a long holiday abroad.
sentences.chinese: 之后他的身体累垮了，得去国外休一段长假。

sentences.english: In the end, all those hours will tire you out so that you don’t want to do anything really.
sentences.chinese: 到最后长时间的工作会把你累垮，让你什么都不想做。

definition: to become exhausted
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
tired/exhausted/worn out/to toil
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
rope/to bind together/to twist around
surname Lei
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
tired to the point of dropping
physically and emotionally exhausted
to be unable to tolerate or endure/to find sth difficult to manage
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to accumulate work causes sickness (idiom); to fall ill from constant overwork
tired/exhausted
to work hard/to look after
to fall ill/to be stricken with an illness
to make oneself do sth in spite of adversity, pain etc
lit. the body is the revolution's capital/fig. good health is a prerequisite for work (Mao Zedong's saying)
pinyin: shen1 ti3 shi4 ge2 ming4 de5 ben3 qian2
